definition: to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
to fight/fight/war/battle
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
(negative prefix)/not/no

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4 , gong1 wu2 bu4 ke4

definition: to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4 , gong1 wu2 bu4 qu3

definition: to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: gong1 wu2 bu4 ke4 , zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4

sentences.english: Love conquers all things except poverty and toothache.
sentences.chinese: 因此，愛情戰無不勝，只戰不勝貧窮與牙痛。

sentences.english: Because of a friend's help and encouragement, you will be invincible and indomitable.
sentences.chinese: 因爲朋友的相助和激勵，你纔會戰無不勝，一往無前。

sentences.english: Before his heart attack, he said, “I thought I was invincible.
sentences.chinese: 他說“做心臟手術之前，我覺得我戰無不勝。”

sentences.english: Let us disabuse ourselves of the idea that we are invincible.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們打消我們是戰無不勝的錯誤念頭。

sentences.english: Your companions have become victorious, what are you waiting for now?
sentences.chinese: 你的同伴已成爲戰無不勝的，你還在等什麼，現在？

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to charge and break through enemy lines
resourceful/full of stratagems
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to receive worldwide attention
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
courtesy name of Zhao Yun 趙雲|赵云[Zhao4 Yun2], general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4

definition: to be chivalrous
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
